page.title: 05AMENITIES OF EAST STOKE
page.content: After a campaign to keep it open the {Church of England}primary school was closed in 1984, in spite of the fact that a new school had been built during the expansionary period of the sixties. The 20 pupils now travel by special bus to{Elston.}Attempts are being made to sell the old school building for light industrial use. There is an hourly bus service to {Newark}and{Nottingham}and 5 buses a day to{Bingham.}There is one telephone box, but no Post Office or shop. This necessitates travelling to{Newark}for shopping. There is one public house called the Pauncefote Arms which serves bar snacks and meals and has a skittle alley. The C. of E.{Church {of St Oswald}is 1/2 mile west of the village adjacent to the privately owned Stoke Hall.
